main event: A civilian observer saw a very fast moving, intense red light that split into two parts and then back into one as it approached the horizon in Lebanon, Ohio on July 3, 1965.
interesting points: The object had a metallic shine and made no sound.
The object seemed to be an illusion or reflection from the moon.

The object was reported by 10 witnesses on a tower near a road, who described a large metallic object with a dome and blinking lights, about 10 feet long and 3 feet thick, that disappeared after 3 minutes with no noise.
The report was evaluated as an unidentified sighting, although the object could not be conclusively identified.
sighted object: a fast moving, intense red light that split into two and then back into one
witnesses: civilian observer, 10 witnesses on a tower
